title: About Me
text:
I have a deep passion for working towards environmental justice, social equity and global health through regenerative agriculture, a return to indigenous stewardship, promoting food sovereignty and the continued elevation of voices that are typically ignored and oppressed. I love to work with people, always be challenged in the workplace, and remain a lifelong learner.

title: Graycen Mahon
text:
Hi! Thanks for stopping by my website, created by yours truly using R Studio- a programming language for statistical computing, graphics and website construction. My name is Graycen Mahon and I am originally from the Bay Area. I recently graduated from the University of California, Santa Barbara in 2023, with a Bachelor of Arts in both Environmental Studies and Sociology.

Please explore my page to review my work experiences, community involvement, writing samples and person interests! I am happy to have you here.

title: Work Experience
text:
Camp Manager (December 2022)

Gymtowne Gymnastics South San Francisco, CA


Managed a staff of 25 employees and made weekly schedules


Created daily lesson plans for students satisfying a wide margin of ages and skill level


Oversaw the safety of children ages 4-13 in gymnastics activities


Ensured allergies, dietary restrictions, and medications were known for 20+ children, and supervised the administration of personal medications when necessary


Facilitated conflict management and fostered a supportive, welcoming and fun environment for both the staff and participants over the 2 week period


Solved scheduling issues and supported the staff






Lead Teacher (January 2022 - June 2022)

SproutUp, Goleta, CA


Spearheaded weekly lesson plans for 2nd-3rd graders on the local environment and sustainability


Invited to be a lead teacher and led a teaching team of 5 other UCSB students


Responsible for gathering and organizing the various materials needed weekly to teach the students


Facilitated weekly communication with staff members of the school to address potential challenges and scheduling


Successfully taught at a local elementary school classroom weekly for 18 weeks


Oversaw conflicts and endorsed a safe and welcoming learning environment over the 18 weeks






Hospitality/Customer Service (April 2021-June 2023)

Scarlett Begonia, Santa Barbara, CA


Trained incoming employees and called on first for promotions by the manager and restaurant owner


Promoted to Head Hostess within 3 months and supervised a staff of 6 individuals; retained a positive and efficient work environment


Managed high volumes of customers, food orders, and phone calls; averaging about 200-450 individuals per day


Responsible for inventory control, and maintained a well stocked service station and bar area to meets the needs of the 30+ active tables


Acted as a liaison between the 7 member Spanish speaking kitchen staff and the 3-5 servers to ensure any allergies/dietary restrictions were known and accounted for; became proficient enough in Spanish to guarantee success


Upheld a pleasant environment for customers by cultivating a positive attitude, successfully navigating a high stress work setting, multitasking, and improving the productivity of a 30+ member staff






Youth Gymnastics Coach (November 2016-July 2020)

Gymtowne Gymnastics, SSF, CA


Led weekly classes of 5-6 children ranging from 2-13 years old


Fostered the development of 5 important skills within students; listening, cooperation, communication, respecting boundaries, and improving motor function


Coached many children with different physical, mental, and language abilities, successfully meeting their individual needs and maintaining a streamline class setting


Supervised the safety of each student, while still encouraging a fun environment for students to learn on a weekly basis


Spearheaded birthday parties on the weekend and built an exciting atmosphere for children and adults, while also sustaining the safety and organization of the group of 30+ individuals


Communicated weekly with the parents of all 6 students for each class and successfully relayed important developmental and behavioral information






Volunteer Researcher (September 2020-March 2021)

Reform Revolution Project (RRP), Remote, Founded in Sacramento, CA


Researched and created informational instagram content about the history of Black oppression within specific topics including; environmental racism, voting rights, and social justice


Collaborated with 10 other team members of different racial, cultural and gender identities while navigating race topics with mindfulness and awareness


Expanded skills such as; cooperation, communication, listening, learning, and writing and applied them successfully to tasks as a volunteer


Furthered my own knowledge of the current presence and history of racism within the United States
